documents.title: Hafedh-Profile
documents.content:
Contact Hafedh Ridene
www.linkedin.com/in/hafedh- Founder & CEO at Rydentech | Digital Transformation | IT
ridene-profile-09 (LinkedIn) Automation
Dublin, County Dublin, Ireland
Top Skills
Summary
Agile Methodologies
Business Planning
Enthusiastic and dedicated professional with extensive experience
Personal Development
across several IT domains. A leader in developing new innovative
visions for the business and driving teams towards business goals.
Languages
Provides innovative solutions outside the box to explore new areas
Spanish (Limited Working)
or to resolve a complex problem and is highly skilled in problem
English (Full Professional)
solving. Able to analyze a very complex situation and provide a
Arabic (Limited Working)
mid- / long-term solution using inference and inductive reasoning
French (Native or Bilingual)
to build a logical structure that aims to support teams to reach their
goals with the minimum hurdles possible. Engages team to work
in synergy and provide their best performance to achieve business
goals. Possesses intercultural fluency and is committed to a culture
of inclusion Supports teams in adapting and collaborating.
Teams Management | Projects Management | Process Automation
| IT Services Architecture and Governance | IT Architecture |
Culture Implementation | Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) |
Leadership | Problem Solving
Experience
Rydentech
CEO at Rydentech
December 2023 - Present (1 year 6 months)
Ireland
At the forefront of technological innovation, specializing in cutting-edge
solutions for Intelligent Automation (IA) which is the State-of-the-art
technologies combination related to Business Process Management (BPM –
Including: Business Process Automation (BPA) & Robotic process automation
(RPA)) and Artificial Intelligence (AI).
Novartis
8 years 9 months
Page 1 of 6

Service Delivery Expert (Automation)
May 2018 - November 2023 (5 years 7 months)
County Dublin, Ireland
- Generate report on a monthly basis that reflect accurately the Runbook
Automation Service Health.
- Generate the required KPIs for the Executive Dashboard on a monthly basis.
- Act as the primary connection between service delivery Team and the
business for the Automation related capabilities and Services delivered by
SPE M&A Teams.
- Ensure IT services are aligned with business strategy, business objectives,
business requirements, standards and regulations
- Understand the processes, plans, objectives, drivers, and issues related
to the business capability, as well as the appropriate external policies and
regulations.
- Identify and qualify new demand with overall responsibility for steering
proposals through the early phases of approval
- Participate in establishment of budgets and investment proposals and obtain
sponsorship and funding
- Ensure the introduction of new / modified services happens in a planned,
controlled and timely manner to minimize disruption and maximize benefit
- Provide IT consulting to the capability stakeholders, educate them on IT
processes and methodologies and drive adoption of global solutions
- Ensure service adherence with quality, compliance and security standards
and delivery of associated corrective service actions
- Provide a uniform approach to the way in which customer feedback is
handled and resolved
- Ensure technology impact analysis is provided to business
- Facilitates project kick-offs contributing to the success of a project team
- Take accountability to ensure adherence with Security and Compliance
policies and procedures within Service Delivery scope.
Service Delivery Expert
May 2018 - November 2023 (5 years 7 months)
County Dublin, Ireland
Runbook Automation Architect
February 2017 - May 2018 (1 year 4 months)
County Dublin, Ireland
- Develop Runbook Automation Architecture.
- Ensure that the Runbook Automation Services are aligned with the overall
strategy, objectives, requirements, architecture, standards and roadmaps.
Page 2 of 6

- Lead the Automation Teams and steer them to avoid any deviation/Risks that
may impact the business goals.
- Ensure that the system set-up is aligned with delivery team framework and
development studio.
- Providing adequate resources for Business Level Support (Super-Users) and
system validation efforts.
- Ensuring that data and application is appropriately managed.
- Ensuring validation and maintenance of the status as validated system.
- Ensuring that appropriate change and system management control is
implemented and maintained.
- Deciding on and approving system retirement.
ITTP Monitoring Lead Architect
July 2015 - January 2017 (1 year 7 months)
Dublin, Ireland
Role Purpose:
My role is to assume responsibility for the overall design and coordination of
information technology and understand how architectures, strategies, designs
and plans fit together.
I am responsible for delivery and deployment of technical project, practices
and processes based on IT Service Management (ITSM) products and
solutions.
I had to know the IT landscape with good understanding of the technology map
across the board. The ability to independently lead initiatives and drive them
to success in order to satisfy NVS internal customers’ needs, to innovate a
solution or to leverage a new IT capability.
Accountability Areas:
- Provides IT Architecture Solutions for IT services, systems and applications
assessed to have a low to medium impact and risk to the business processes
they underpin.
- Responsible for partnering and serving one or more functional areas.
- Ensures adherence to quality standards as defined by the IT Organization.
- Ensures appropriate response to audit / IGM assessment findings and
recommendations.
- Develop appropriate solution designs and documentation in support of
projects and changes as called upon by the Head of ITTP Architecture &
Engineering.
Page 3 of 6

- Collaborate with Service Integration and the functional ITTP organizations to
continuously explore improvement ideas.
- Advocate and be the voice of NVS internal customers. Show a high empathy
level with their concerns and support formalizing their needs and lead solutions
delivery that fit their requirement.
ITTP Monitoring Systems Engineer
March 2015 - June 2015 (4 months)
County Dublin, Ireland
Role Purpose:
As a system-monitoring engineer, my mission is to ensure the successful
end-to-end operation of IT systems / the successful design, development,
deployment and maintenance of software and applications.
The role supports the optimal planning and execution of all activities
associated with a system or software release to ensure the end-to-end
deployment.
I have to provide analytical support for support and problem resolution and
problem prevention.
The primary responsibilities are to establish:
• Maintain and document the Monitoring Systems at Novartis.
• Solution design for the primary Monitoring relevant tool suites, associated
interfaces and supporting modules.
• Engineering oversight for the various migration and customer on-boarding
projects.
Accountability areas:
• IT professional delivering technical expertise in support of a specific system
or application or technology environment.
• Executes defined system administration activities on an allocated/defined
application, system or technology environment.
• Supports design, develops and implements application / system builds.
• Assist in projects planning, development and tests or implements changes.
• Writes documentation specific to the allocated/defined application, system or
technology environment (e.g. operations manuals, validation documentation,
build documentation)
• Establish and manage governance processes supporting adherence to
the relevant technology standards and development practices across the
monitoring domain.
Page 4 of 6

• Provide consulting as called upon throughout the Novartis enterprise on
monitoring-related issues.
• Keep up-to-date and knowledgeable about industry trends and emerging
technologies, promoting a recommended direction for information and
analytical systems.
Hewlett-packard Spain
SW Named Advanced Support Engineer (NASE) Engineer
October 2008 - November 2014 (6 years 2 months)
Working with HP hot Big Account, I had the responsibility to make global
infrastructure health check by assessing HP and third party products
compatibility, high level architecture, figure-out any bottleneck on the platform
that may impact the system production effectiveness and performance.
One of my main role is assist on environment migration, architecture change
or environment upgrade. In case of system down I should proactively be
available for customer and ensure the system availability. Provide a regular
insight reporting to spot repetitive issues. Process them as a problem after a
specified number of occurrences to enhance the current process and ensure
experiences learning. Develop a process based on predict to prevent model.
I am responsible for mission critical escalations and advocate the customer till
the issue resolution.
Customize the customer environment to fit strategically its needs in direct
collaboration with R&D.
ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
My responsibility was to ensure that support is delivered in a way that meets
the highest quality. As NASE I was closely involved in working the technical
issues and to focus on taking direct ownership of the reactive issues during
the Premier Support Hours. I had to spot any systemic issues that may exist
across multiple incidents.
As part of my role, I had to ensure the following abilities:
- High availability for customer, understand his needs,
- Spot the customer business needs, formulate the request and submit the
demand.
Page 5 of 6

- NASE takes ownership for all problems or monitor to find correct resource for
the issue and monitor the case. TAM monitors cases progress.
- Central point of contract of all other support issues.
- Call and stay in close contact with the customer on a regular basis even if
they do not open cases or proactive activities.
- Proactively call them to check how thing are going.
- Good proactive ”soft-skills” will help you along the way and make renewal
much easier.
SELLBYTEL Group
HP Technical Support Engineer (Subcontractor)
June 2007 - October 2008 (1 year 5 months)
Dataprotector Support Engineer:
- Technical support for HP Worldwide customers.
- Advices and best practices to our customer to get the maximum value of the
product.
- Supporting customers to achieve a successful data restore after performing a
valid backup.
- Remote troubleshooting sessions (Webex, Virtual Room).
Troubleshooting in Dataprotector required the at least basic knowledge on the
following products:
- Operating Systems (HP-UX, Linux, Windows, VMWARE, Netware, Solaris).
- Network Technologies (LAN, SAN, NAS, DAS,).
- Knowledge in third applications (Exchange, MS - SQL, Oracle, Lotus Notes,
SAP).
Education
Institut Supérieur d'Informatique (I.S.I.)
Master's Degree, Technology of Systems Information and Communication
(TSIC) · (2001 - 2004)
Pere Blanc (High School)
Bachelor's Degree, Technical section · (1994 - 2001)
Page 6 of 6
